title: How to Level Up Your Woodworking in Elder Scrolls Online

steps.headline: Find some wood.
steps.description: Wood can be found anywhere. If you get a perk called “Keen Eye: Wood” under the Woodworking skill tree, you can spot wood easier in the world because it will glow brightly when you get close.

steps.headline: Locate a Woodworking Station.
steps.description: These can be found in any major town. If you look at your map, you will see an arrow point with a block in front of it; this is the icon that lets you know there is a Woodworking Station nearby.

steps.headline: Activate the station.
steps.description: Once you find the Woodworking Station, walk up to it and press the A button to open the menu.

steps.headline: Select “Refine” from the list of options.
steps.description: You can find “Refine” at the very top of this list; just hit the A button to open the Refine options.

steps.headline: Refine the wood that you have collected while you were out adventuring.
steps.description: Hit the A button over the wood that you wish to refine. There are varying types, each stronger than the last: Maple, Oak, Beech, Hickory, Yew, Birch, Ash, Mahogany, and Nightwood. Every time you refine something, you will see your overall Woodworking level increase.

steps.headline: Go to a Woodworking Station.
steps.description: You can spot them on the map because they have an arrow with a block of wood on the end. You can find a Woodworking Station in any town.

steps.headline: Activate the station.
steps.description: Once you find one, walk up to it and hit the A button to open your woodworking menu.

steps.headline: Open the Create menu.
steps.description: Tap the A button under “Create”; it is the second option down. A menu will pop up with four boxes that you have to set to create your new item.

steps.headline: Pick an item you want to make in the first box.
steps.description: You can make bows, staffs, or shields. Move the slider left and right until you find the piece that you want to create.

steps.headline: Pick the type of wood to use.
steps.description: Go down to the next box; this is where you will pick the type of wood you want to use to create your item. Remember, the better the wood quality, the better the item that you will create. You have to start low level to make the best things, but it is well worth it. Scroll through until you find the type of wood you want to use.

steps.headline: Select the Style material.
steps.description: Hit the down button, which will bring you to the third box. In this box, you will need to choose a Style material for the item you are creating. Every race has a different style item, so you would need to pick the appropriate style for the item you want to craft. For instance, Redguards need Starmetal to craft their particular type of gear.

steps.headline: Add a trait gem if you have the proper materials.
steps.description: A trait gem is not necessary to craft an item, but it can add some nice perks. You could give your bow more damage, for instance, if you have the right gem to do it. Style and Trait gems are scattered all throughout the world, make sure you loot everything so that you can to find all of the best ones!

steps.headline: Craft!
steps.description: Hit the X button to craft your wood item. When you hit “Craft,” the item will appear in your inventory, and your Woodworking level will increase.

steps.headline: Check your inventory to make sure you have wood items that can be deconstructed.
steps.description: The items that can be broken down at Woodworking Stations are bows, staffs, and wooden shields.

steps.headline: Visit a Woodworking Station.
steps.description: These can be found in pretty much any major town. You will know you found a Woodworking Station when you see a big table with wood and hammers on it, and a big piece of lumber resting against the side of the table.

steps.headline: Activate the station.
steps.description: Once you find a table, go up to it and hit A to open up the Woodworking menu.

steps.headline: Open the Deconstruction menu.
steps.description: Look at the options listed in the menu. The third option down says “Deconstruct”; go down to it and hit the A button to open up the Deconstruction menu.

steps.headline: Select a wood item to deconstruct.
steps.description: On the left side of the screen you will see all the wood items you have in your inventory that can be deconstructed. Scroll through your items until you find something you want to deconstruct.

steps.headline: Deconstruct the item.
steps.description: Once you’ve selected the item, hit the A button. If you look at the top right side of your screen, you will see all the items you gained from deconstruction. You will see that your Woodworking experience also increased at the bottom right side of the screen.

steps.headline: Check your inventory for wood items to improve.
steps.description: Look in your inventory by hitting Start and clicking the A button on your Inventory tab. See what kind of wood items you can improve. You can usually improve any staff, bow, or wooden shield. Find the item you want to improve and remember it.

steps.headline: Find a Woodworking Station.
steps.description: These can be located in any major city. If you look at your map you can see that there is an icon with the top half of an arrow with a wooden block above it; this is the Woodworking Station. You can see the table in the world as a big table with wood pieces and a hammer on it.

steps.headline: Activate the station.
steps.description: Once you find the table, walk up to it and hit the A button. This will open up the woodworking menu.

steps.headline: Open the Improvement menu.
steps.description: Go to the fourth item down on the list that says “Improvement” and hit the A button over it. This will open the improvement menu. You will see all your items that can be improved on the left side of the screen.

steps.headline: Select the item to improve.
steps.description: Scroll through the list on the left side until you find the one you want to improve. Once you find it, hit the A button.

steps.headline: Select a resin.
steps.description: The screen will change and allow you to pick a resin to use for improvement. Resins are used to improve your items. There are four kinds of resins: Pitch, Turpen, Mastic, and Rosin. You need to use Pitch to turn a white item green, Turpen to change a green item to blue, Mastic to turn blue items to purple, and Rosin to turn purple items to orange. Each color represents a rarity level, with orange being legendary.

steps.headline: Pick how much resin you want to use to improve your item.
steps.description: Do this by going left and right on your controller. You can use between one and five resins per improvement. Be very careful when choosing the number of resins you want to use! One resin will make your chances of improvement 20%. If it fails, the item and your resin will be destroyed. The best way to play it safe is to use five resins per improvement so that you have a 100% improvement chance. You can see your percentage at the top right side of the screen.

steps.headline: Improve the item.
steps.description: Hit the X button to improve your item. Every time you pull off a successful improvement, your Woodworking experience will increase.

text: Refining Wood Find some wood. Wood can be found anywhere. If you get a perk called “Keen Eye: Wood” under the Woodworking skill tree, you can spot wood easier in the world because it will glow brightly when you get close. Locate a Woodworking Station. These can be found in any major town. If you look at your map, you will see an arrow point with a block in front of it; this is the icon that lets you know there is a Woodworking Station nearby. Activate the station. Once you find the Woodworking Station, walk up to it and press the A button to open the menu. Select “Refine” from the list of options. You can find “Refine” at the very top of this list; just hit the A button to open the Refine options. Refine the wood that you have collected while you were out adventuring. Hit the A button over the wood that you wish to refine. There are varying types, each stronger than the last: Maple, Oak, Beech, Hickory, Yew, Birch, Ash, Mahogany, and Nightwood. Every time you refine something, you will see your overall Woodworking level increase. Creating Wood Items Go to a Woodworking Station. You can spot them on the map because they have an arrow with a block of wood on the end. You can find a Woodworking Station in any town. Activate the station. Once you find one, walk up to it and hit the A button to open your woodworking menu. Open the Create menu. Tap the A button under “Create”; it is the second option down. A menu will pop up with four boxes that you have to set to create your new item. Pick an item you want to make in the first box. You can make bows, staffs, or shields. Move the slider left and right until you find the piece that you want to create. Pick the type of wood to use. Go down to the next box; this is where you will pick the type of wood you want to use to create your item. Remember, the better the wood quality, the better the item that you will create. You have to start low level to make the best things, but it is well worth it. Scroll through until you find the type of wood you want to use. Select the Style material. Hit the down button, which will bring you to the third box. In this box, you will need to choose a Style material for the item you are creating. Every race has a different style item, so you would need to pick the appropriate style for the item you want to craft. For instance, Redguards need Starmetal to craft their particular type of gear. Add a trait gem if you have the proper materials. A trait gem is not necessary to craft an item, but it can add some nice perks. You could give your bow more damage, for instance, if you have the right gem to do it. Style and Trait gems are scattered all throughout the world, make sure you loot everything so that you can to find all of the best ones! Craft! Hit the X button to craft your wood item. When you hit “Craft,” the item will appear in your inventory, and your Woodworking level will increase. Deconstructing Wood Items Check your inventory to make sure you have wood items that can be deconstructed. The items that can be broken down at Woodworking Stations are bows, staffs, and wooden shields. Visit a Woodworking Station. These can be found in pretty much any major town. You will know you found a Woodworking Station when you see a big table with wood and hammers on it, and a big piece of lumber resting against the side of the table. Activate the station. Once you find a table, go up to it and hit A to open up the Woodworking menu. Open the Deconstruction menu. Look at the options listed in the menu. The third option down says “Deconstruct”; go down to it and hit the A button to open up the Deconstruction menu. Select a wood item to deconstruct. On the left side of the screen you will see all the wood items you have in your inventory that can be deconstructed. Scroll through your items until you find something you want to deconstruct. Deconstruct the item. Once you’ve selected the item, hit the A button. If you look at the top right side of your screen, you will see all the items you gained from deconstruction. You will see that your Woodworking experience also increased at the bottom right side of the screen. Improving Wood Items Check your inventory for wood items to improve. Look in your inventory by hitting Start and clicking the A button on your Inventory tab. See what kind of wood items you can improve. You can usually improve any staff, bow, or wooden shield. Find the item you want to improve and remember it. Find a Woodworking Station. These can be located in any major city. If you look at your map you can see that there is an icon with the top half of an arrow with a wooden block above it; this is the Woodworking Station. You can see the table in the world as a big table with wood pieces and a hammer on it. Activate the station. Once you find the table, walk up to it and hit the A button. This will open up the woodworking menu. Open the Improvement menu. Go to the fourth item down on the list that says “Improvement” and hit the A button over it. This will open the improvement menu. You will see all your items that can be improved on the left side of the screen. Select the item to improve. Scroll through the list on the left side until you find the one you want to improve. Once you find it, hit the A button. Select a resin. The screen will change and allow you to pick a resin to use for improvement. Resins are used to improve your items. There are four kinds of resins: Pitch, Turpen, Mastic, and Rosin. You need to use Pitch to turn a white item green, Turpen to change a green item to blue, Mastic to turn blue items to purple, and Rosin to turn purple items to orange. Each color represents a rarity level, with orange being legendary. Pick how much resin you want to use to improve your item. Do this by going left and right on your controller. You can use between one and five resins per improvement. Be very careful when choosing the number of resins you want to use! One resin will make your chances of improvement 20%. If it fails, the item and your resin will be destroyed. The best way to play it safe is to use five resins per improvement so that you have a 100% improvement chance. You can see your percentage at the top right side of the screen. Improve the item. Hit the X button to improve your item. Every time you pull off a successful improvement, your Woodworking experience will increase.
